attribution.noGuaranteeContent: That attribution data in platform reports matches Shopify order data exactly. Platform attribution is affected by multiple factors including platform algorithms, user privacy settings, cross-device tracking restrictions, and platform data deduplication/merging rules.
attribution.reportContent: If verification shows 'Passed', it means pixel events are normal in this app's reception and validation link; platform-side attribution may still show discrepancies, which is normal.

IngestionKey.Title: Ingestion Key
IngestionKey.Description: Used to associate event requests from Web Pixel. This token helps us:
IngestionKey.Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Filter misconfigured or invalid requests (noise reduction)
‚Ä¢ Correctly associate pixel events with orders (diagnostics)
‚Ä¢ Identify request sources in multi-store scenarios
IngestionKey.SecurityNote: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Security Note: This token is visible in browser network requests and is NOT a strong security boundary. Real security is provided by multiple layers:
IngestionKey.SecurityLayers: ‚Ä¢ TLS Encryption: All data transmission is encrypted via HTTPS ‚Ä¢ Origin Verification: Only accepts requests from Shopify checkout pages (with Referer/ShopDomain fallback) ‚Ä¢ Integrity Verification Key (HMAC): Used for integrity verification and basic abuse prevention ‚Ä¢ Rate Limiting: Prevents abuse and abnormal traffic ‚Ä¢ Data Minimization: We do not collect, process, or send end-customer PII
IngestionKey.BoundaryNote: Security Boundary Note: This token is mainly used for event association and diagnostics. Do not treat this token as a strong security credential.
IngestionKey.ReinstallPrompt: Please reinstall the app or click generate token
IngestionKey.LaxDesc: Non-whitelisted/HMAC failure may still be accepted
IngestionKey.LaxWarning: Requests from non-whitelisted sources or HMAC verification failures that are not rejected may still be accepted and marked as low trust.
IngestionKey.GraceWindow: Old token still valid: Previous token will expire on {{date}}. Until then, both new and old tokens can be used for smooth transition.
IngestionKey.GraceWindowEnd: After the transition period, the old token will automatically expire.
IngestionKey.OldTokenExpired: Old token expired: Previous token has been automatically cleaned up.
IngestionKey.NoTokenError: ‚ö†Ô∏è Association token not configured: Please generate a token immediately.
IngestionKey.NoTokenDesc: When the token is not configured, pixel events can still be received, but integrity signals will decrease.
IngestionKey.P0SecurityDetails: Production environment must explicitly set: ‚Ä¢ PIXEL_ALLOW_NULL_ORIGIN_WITH_SIGNATURE_ONLY env var ‚Ä¢ If set to false, Origin: null requests will be rejected.
IngestionKey.IngestionKeyRisk: ingestionKey Visibility Risk: ‚Ä¢ ingestion_key is distributed to pixel client and is a public signal ‚Ä¢ Real order authenticity should rely on Shopify webhook/order reconciliation
IngestionKey.MustDoActions: Mandatory Actions: ‚Ä¢ Regularly rotate ingestionKey (Recommended every 90 days) ‚Ä¢ Monitor abnormal event reception patterns ‚Ä¢ If abuse suspected, change token immediately
IngestionKey.RotationMechNote: Token Rotation Mechanism Description: When changing token, system automatically saves old token as previousIngestionSecret for 30 minutes grace period.
IngestionKey.HowItWorksDesc: The server records this token and uses it as an integrity signal. Replacing the token initiates a 30-minute grace window for the old token.
IngestionKey.TokenRotationMech: Token Rotation Mechanism: ‚Ä¢ Old token saved as previousIngestionSecret ‚Ä¢ Old token usable for 30 mins ‚Ä¢ System automatically syncs new token to Web Pixel config
